articles.title: NASA, SpaceX set for 3,500 kg cargo resupply mission to International Space Station - India TV News
articles.description: The mission will utilize Northrop Grumman's Cygnus spacecraft (NG-21) and SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket, launched from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.
articles.content: NASA (US space agency) and SpaceX (run by Elon Musk) are set to launch a cargo mission with 8,200 pounds (3,719.45 kg) of supplies, scientific investigations, and equipment to the International Space… [+2154 chars]
